task.summary: Default task
Added the main Framework for Game Handling and Menu Handling
Version 0.1 Demo Working Added: * Character Movement and Crate movement Improvements: * Usage of Location * Readability of code * Re-structured the code packages

Version 0.2 Functionality
Added: * EntityType.java to simplify * Game States functionality * GameStrategy.java for added functionality and untangled code * Start of Level's
Improvements: * Entity.java
Removed: * MenuActionHandler.java as it's purpose is no longer needed * MenuObserver.java as it's purpose is no longer needed * MenuStrategy.java as it's purpose is no longer needed

Refactor codebase into framework pattern
For the purpose of with ease be able to add new features.
Modified Access modifiers
Hotfix 6
Hotfix 6
Improved Class security by updating access Modifiers
Improved Class security by updating access Modifiers
Improved Class security by updating access Modifiers

Add second game view and fixed bugs
In this commit, I've added a second view to the game, which provides a text-based (console output) interface as an alternative to the JSwing output. This will make the game more accessible and versatile.
I've also fixed several bugs in the codebase, including an issue with the Load feature, where it was working differently from the StartMenu and PauseMenu. Additionally, I fixed a bug where the level event was incrementing on load, even if no file was found.

Restructure code and fix bugs related to repainting with GameViewObservers
In this commit, I've restructured the codebase to improve the performance and usability of the observers. This includes refactoring some code to use more modular and reusable components.

Add Restart function to Framework and fix bugs in Sokoban game
In this commit, I've added a Restart function to the Framework, which will allow players to restart the game without having to reload the entire game. This should improve the user experience and make the game more convenient to play.
I've also fixed several bugs in the Sokoban game, including an issue with the Load/Save function, which was not working correctly, and a bug with the Resume Game function, which was causing a wierd GLITCH IN THE MATRIX.
Minor Changes
Minor Changes Added a way to get an entity by location
Minor Changes Added a way to check if one entity is equal to another

Upgrade error handling on load, improve GUI registration/removal, and shorten notification delay
In this commit, I've made some minor changes to enhance the codebase and improve the user experience.
I upgraded the error handling mechanism on load to provide more informative and user-friendly error messages. This will help developers troubleshoot any issues with loading data more effectively.
I also made improvements to the GUI registration and removal process, making it easier to add or remove an view observer. This will enhance the flexibility and modularity of the views. Currently we support Console based and Graphical based
Additionally, I shortened the delay on notifications to make them appear more promptly.

Start working on unit testing and implement first test
In this commit, I've begun working on unit testing for the Sokoban game.
I have implemented the first test, which focuses on the Game module. This test verifies the main functions of the game's states.
This is the initial step in establishing a robust testing framework for the project, which will help catch bugs and ensure the correctness of the codebase.
Minor Change Updated error handling on data read.
Minor Changes and implemented a win screen.

Minor change Changed so that the save file will have the name of the current game title.
Example: Sokoban_save.dat instead of all games having the same save file
Add Javadocs and a minor refactor of the codebase to simplify the menu system.
Part of former commit
Updated Sokoban to use the latest iteration of Framework
Updated Platform to use the latest iteration of Framework
Add JUnit and Mockito test's
Bug Fixes
Tested the switch statements for KeyBoardController
Tested the switch statements for KeyBoardController
Added test to each switch statement. Also tested if setState(GameState.PAUSED) called when the gameboards state is RUNNING and ESC is pressed.
Testrunning Entity.java
Creating maze game
Creating maze game
Creating maze game
United the Observers under one common banner "GameObserver"
Minor Changes to names of classes
Minor Changes
Refactored GameStrategy and Controllers
Minor Changes
Minor Changes
